manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
Provides editor support for recognition of ECLIPSE-style reservoir simulation decks. In addition to all the standard text editing functionality with the built-in NetBeans editor, the following assistive techniques have been implemented:
- Syntax highlighting - Code folding - Code completion - Code formatting - Keyword navigation - Error highlighting - Diff versioning - Language manual

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for editing of ECLIPSE reservoir simulation decks

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
Petroleum engineering classes and utility methods. The module is intended as an extension to Seismic Java which adds rock physics and fluid functionality.
Includes implementations for fluid properties, including Equation of State, pipe flow, static reservoir modelling and preparation of dynamic simulation decks.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: au.com.newwavegeo.eclipse.filetype > 1.0.3, au.com.newwavegeo.mathlib > 1.0.3, ca.odell.glazedlists > 1.11.0, com.fasterxml > 2.15.2, com.google.common > 1.0.0, javax.measure > 0.9.4, javolution > 5.4.3, net.java.dev.truelicense > 1.29.0, org.apache.commons > 1.1.7, org.assertj > 3.17.1, org.coolprop > 6.5.0, org.jscience > 4.3.1, org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.13.1.1, org.netbeans.api.progress.compat8 > 1.52, org.netbeans.api.progress.nb > 1.52, org.netbeans.api.templates > 1.13, org.openide.loaders > 7.5.1, org.openide.modules > 7.53, org.openide.util > 9.30

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Originally intended as a port of the CWP Seismic Unix platform into Java. Provides basic functionality for manipulating seismic and well log data. Includes support for reading and writing of SEG Y files, SU files and SIMP files. Parts of this module have their roots in the original CWP C/C++ code.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: au.com.newwavegeo.graphics > 1.0.9, au.com.newwavegeo.mathlib > 1.0.6, au.com.newwavegeo.peteng > 1.0.1, au.com.newwavegeo.pyruscore > 1.0.15, com.google.common > 1.0.0, hdf.hdf5lib > 1.12.0, javax.measure > 0.9.4, javolution > 5.4.3, net.sf.kdgcommons > 1.0.17, org.apache.commons > 1.1.8, org.jscience > 4.3.1, org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.16.1.1, org.netbeans.api.progress.compat8 > 1.46.1, org.netbeans.api.progress.nb > 1.52, org.netbeans.api.templates > 1.13, org.openide.filesystems.compat8 > 9.14, org.openide.util > 7.31.1.1, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.3.1, org.openide.util.ui > 9.13

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A class library containing general purpose functionality for manipulating graphics. Contains useful swing components for general purpose graphics tasks.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: au.com.newwavegeo.jai > 1.1.3.2, au.com.newwavegeo.mathlib > 1.0, com.google.common > 1.0, com.jhlabs.image > 1.0, javolution > 5.4.3, org.apache.commons > 1.1.8, org.jfree.chart > 1.5.4, org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.16.1.1, org.netbeans.api.progress.compat8 > 1.52, org.netbeans.api.progress.nb > 1.52, org.openide.util > 7.31.1.1, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.3.1, org.openide.util.ui > 9.13

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: General purpose mathematical functions. These either wrap methods from Apache Commons-Math, or use source edited from JTK (successor to SeismicUnix) and SSJ (Stochastical Simulation for Java). Where possible the module has tried to eliminate duplication of similar routines. - Complex numbers - Statistics - Distributions and Monte Carlo tools - Fourier transformation and inverse
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: javolution > 5.4.3, org.apache.commons > 1.1.2, org.assertj > 3.17.1, org.jscience > 4.3.1, org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.13.1.1, org.netbeans.api.progress.compat8 > 1.52, org.netbeans.api.progress.nb > 1.52, org.netbeans.modules.autoupdate.services > 1.81

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Petrophysics classes and utility methods. The module is intended as an extension to Seismic Java which adds the ability to handle well logs. Support for reading and writing LAS files according to the Canadian Well Logging Society standard is provided.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: au.com.newwavegeo.peteng > 1.0.1, au.com.newwavegeo.pyruscore > 1.0.15, javax.measure > 0.9.4, javolution > 5.4.3, org.jscience > 4.3.1, org.openide.filesystems > 9.34, org.openide.loaders > 7.91, org.openide.nodes > 7.66, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.55, org.openide.util.ui > 9.30

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module allows images to be viewed. A variety of image formats can be viewed and edited using this module. Whilst it does not attempt to be a replacement for a dedicated graphics editing software package, it does feature optimisation to allow very large scanned images (such as scanned high resolution seismic sections or well logs) to be viewed and edited without running into memory issues. Comparison testing has revealed, surprisingly, that several commercial image editing programs are unable to cope with the very large files that Pyrus is able to open.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: au.com.newwavegeo.graphics > 1.0.9, au.com.newwavegeo.jai > 1.1.3.4, au.com.newwavegeo.mathlib > 1.0.6, au.com.newwavegeo.pyruscore > 1.0.15, au.com.newwavegeo.sj > 1.0.4, com.formdev > 3.2.5, com.jhlabs.image > 1.0.0, com.sun.media.imageioimpl.common > 1.1.5, javolution > 5.5.1, org.apache.commons > 1.1.8, org.jdesktop > 1.0, org.netbeans.api.progress/1 > 1.69, org.netbeans.api.progress.nb > 1.69, org.netbeans.api.templates > 1.30, org.netbeans.modules.projectapi/1 > 1.92, org.netbeans.modules.projectuiapi/1 > 1.110.0.8, org.netbeans.modules.settings/1 > 1.71, org.openide.awt > 7.89, org.openide.dialogs > 7.67, org.openide.filesystems > 9.34, org.openide.filesystems.nb > 9.35, org.openide.loaders > 7.91, org.openide.nodes > 7.66, org.openide.util > 9.29, org.openide.util.lookup > 8.55, org.openide.util.ui > 9.30, org.openide.windows > 6.98

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
This module component allows well logs to be viewed.
Also includes the ability to read and write these file formats: LAS.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Display component for well log data and derivatives.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Contains icons and graphics that override the default NetBeans branding.

Code that is under development, but which still be needed for other modules, may be included here. Once the code reaches a certain maturity level, it is intended that it should be migrated to a different module.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Pyrus project core is a required part of the Pyrus Suite. It is used to manage the various data sources within a project and to provide common functionality needed by the GUI within the NetBeans Platform.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Data management and common file support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
This module allows reservoir models and related information to be viewed. This includes the static model, with the grid and cell properties (porosity, permeability, saturations etc.), as well as the dynamic model with rock and fluid flow properties (viscosities, formation volume factors, relative permeabilities etc.), well locations and schedule logic.
Includes the ability to read and export ECLIPSE format simulation decks.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description:
This module allows 2D seismic sections to be viewed.
Also includes the ability to read and write these file formats: SEG-Y (rev 0 and rev 1).
